Comment 1: 
It is standard behavior for properly block-scoped languages that local declarations
shadow declarations in outer scopes.

You are not redefining the global variable, you are declaring a new local variable a in
main, and thus you will see that new variable. You may feel that the declaration via
":=" is not "visible" enough; in that case you always (except in init statements of if,
for, switch) have the option to write "var a = 1" which is equivalent.
